step_feedback.feedback: In step 1, focus on making a tight fist and drawing your arms in. Your shoulder and elbow alignment looks good, but try to keep your wrists straighter.
For step 2, ensure your fingers open fully as you extend your arms. Your shoulder and elbow positions are good, but pay attention to keeping your wrists straight and relaxed.
In step 3, continue to open your fingers wide and relax your muscles as you exhale. Your shoulder and elbow movements are good. Focus on keeping your wrists aligned with your forearms.
Step 4 involves exhaling and relaxing your muscles. Your shoulder and elbow movements are consistent. Try to maintain a straighter wrist alignment throughout the movement.
For step 5, continue to focus on the outward arm movement and muscle relaxation. Your shoulder and elbow positions are good. Work on keeping your wrists in a neutral position.

exercise_summary: You're doing great with the arm movements! Remember to make a tight fist and inhale in the first part, then open your fingers wide and exhale as you extend your arms. Keep your wrists straight.
